description: CAIGA online tips dataset - Example for GitHub/web hosting

low_health.text: Your health is critical—eat food immediately!
Take cover and regenerate health before engaging enemies.
Golden apples provide instant healing plus absorption hearts.
Healing potions restore health quickly in emergencies.

low_food.text: Hunt animals or harvest crops—you need food now.
Cooked meat provides more saturation than raw.
Baked potatoes are easy to farm and restore decent hunger.
Golden carrots offer the best saturation in the game.
Keep a stack of food in your hotbar for quick access.

night_risk.text: Night brings danger—find shelter or light up your area.
Place torches around your base to prevent mob spawns.
Sleep in a bed to reset your spawn and skip the night.
Phantoms attack if you haven't slept in 3+ days.

mining_mode.text: Mining at low depth? Watch for lava pools and cave-ins.
Always carry a water bucket when mining deep.
Mark your path with torches to find your way back.
Diamonds spawn most frequently between Y=-64 and Y=16.
Branch mining is efficient for finding ores.
Fortune III pickaxe maximizes diamond and coal yields.

near_resource.text: Valuable resource spotted—mine it with the right tool!
Iron and above require a stone pickaxe or better.
Silk Touch preserves blocks like ores and glass.
Smelt ores in a furnace to get ingots.

exploring.text: Write down your base coordinates before exploring far.
Place torches on the right wall to navigate caves easily.
Bring extra food, torches, and tools on long journeys.
Villages offer loot, trading, and a safe place to rest.
Map out interesting landmarks with a map and compass.
Elytra and fireworks make exploration much faster.

combat.text: Keep your shield up when facing skeletons and creepers.
Critical hits deal extra damage—jump and attack.
Potions of strength boost melee damage considerably.

building.text: Plan your base layout before committing resources.
Light up your base interior to prevent mob spawns.
Use different block types for visual variety.
Stairs and slabs add depth and detail to builds.
